arm_group.arm_group_label: Existing water management and cooking practices
arm_group.description: Households in the control arm continue following their existing drinking water management and cooking practices

arm_group.arm_group_label: Provision of water filters and improved cookstoves
arm_group.description: Households in intervention arm are provided with drinking water filters and improved cook stoves

brief_summary.textblock:
DelAgua Health and Development, Manna Energy and the Rwanda Ministry of Health are
      collaborating on a project financed by carbon credits that will distribute household-based
      water filters and high-efficiency cook stoves to approximately 700,000 households in Rwanda.
      Prior to the full roll out of the campaign, the implementers are conducting a pilot project
      among 2000 households in western Rwanda. The objectives of this pilot evaluation are to
      document the delivery of the intervention to the intervention population, assess coverage
      and uptake of the intervention target households and conduct a 5-month randomised controlled
      trial among 500 households to assess the impact of the intervention on drinking water
      quality and indoor air quality.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of a Project to Distribute Water Filters and Cookstoves in Western Rwanda
clinical_study.condition: Faecal Contamination of Household Drinking Water (Environmental Outcome)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  All households in three selected villages

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  None

intervention.arm_group_label: Provision of water filters and improved cookstoves
intervention.description: The intervention consists of providing households with a household-based drinking water filter (Lifestraw® Family version 2.0) and high efficiency cook stoves (Eco Zoom) as well as instructions on how to use them. The intervention is delivered at community level through community health workers (CHWs). Following initial distribution of the products, CHWs visit households fortnightly to reinforce messages about correct and consistent use.
intervention.intervention_name: Household drinking water filters and cookstoves

clinical_study.official_title: ASSESSING THE IMPACT OF WATER FILTERS AND IMPROVED COOK STOVES ON DRINKING WATER QUALITY AND INDOOR AIR POLUTION: A RANDOMISED CONTROLED TRIAL IN RWANDA

authority: United Kingdom: LSHTM Research Ethics Committee
Rwanda: National Ethics Committee, Ministry of Health

primary_outcome.description: Faecal contamination levels (thermotolerant coliforms) in household drinking water. Household drinking water quality will be monitored monthly over a 5-month period.
primary_outcome.measure: Thermotolerant coliforms in household drinking water

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_affiliation: London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine

secondary_outcome.description: PM2.5 concentrations measured in reported main cooking area once (24-hour period) in a sub-sample of 120 households.
Questionnaires, direct observations and electronic monitoring devices
secondary_outcome.measure: Adherence - use of water filters and cookstoves

clinical_study.source: London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine

lead_sponsor.agency: London School of Hygiene and Tropical Medicine

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Prevention
